Notes about Japnese dining

INteresting video about cooking with fermentation https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_MOuX6np5LM&ab_channel=JapanTravel

Edamame
枝豆
pronounced: edamame
meaning: edamame

Gyoza
餃子
pronounced: gyoza
meaning: dumplings

Miso Soup
味噌汁
pronounced: miso shiru
meaning: fermented soybean paste soup/juice
Miso soup with with tofu and green onion

Pickled Ginger
ガリ
pronounced: gari
meaning: sweet pickled ginger

Sake - Nihonshu
日本酒
pronounced: nihon shu
meaning: Japanese liquor
Nihonshu is a brewed and fermented liquor using rice, water, and koji.

Soy Sauce
醬油
pronounced: shōyu
meaning: soy sauce

Sushi
寿司
pronounced: zushi
meaning: sushi
Seasoned rice accompanied with a variety of ingredients, such as fish -often raw- and vegetables

Sushi - Maki Roll
巻き寿司
pronounced: maki zushi
meaning: wound sushi
Rolled sushi, generally wrapped in nori (seaweed) and cut into six to eight pieces

Sushi - Uramaki Roll
裏巻き寿司
pronounced: ura maki zushi
meaning: inside, reverse wound sushi
A popular western creation, it is an 'inside out' maki roll with the rice on the outside of the roll.

Sushi - Nigiri
握り寿司
pronounced: nigiri zushi
meaning: hand pressed sushi
A mound of sushi rice typically topped with raw fish

Sushi - Temaki Hand Roll
手巻寿司
pronounced: temaki zushi
meaning: hand wound sushi
A cone-shaped style of sushi with nori (seaweed) on the outside and ingredients spilling out the wide end

Wasabi
山葵
pronounced: wasabi
meaning: wasabi
A pungent spicy paste

Water
水
pronounced: mizu
meaning: water
お冷
pronounced: ohiya
meaning: cold drinking water

White Steamed Rice
ご飯
pronounced: gohan
meaning: cooked rice
